Body: I am working on an IoT project in which I am required to use Google's geolocation API. Well I know it can be called via HTTP request, is there any way I can call it via MQTT as I think it will be more power efficient and have publish/subscribe approach as I want?
so you want to push your location to a  MQTT broker?
because in MQTT you just dont call anything... you subscribe to a topic....
Yes I have to push location to a broker. But are you suggesting to use http to get location from geolocation API and this cannot be performed using MTQQ?
you need to use the API to get the location and then publish that to the broker
